meanings.definition: Capable of being isolated or separated from others.
meanings.sent1: The red apple was easily isolatable from the green ones.
meanings.sent2: The unique sound of the bird made it isolatable from the rest of the flock.
meanings.sent3: The isolatable cookie in the jar was the last one left.
meanings.sent4: Her isolatable talent for painting shone brightly among her other skills.
meanings.sent5: The isolatable star in the sky twinkled with a special glow.

meanings.definition: Able to be identified or distinguished from a group.
meanings.sent1: The distinct smell of the flower made it isolatable in the garden.
meanings.sent2: His isolatable handwriting made it easy to recognize his notes.
meanings.sent3: The isolatable cat in the neighborhood always wore a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: Her isolatable laugh echoed through the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The isolatable scent of fresh bread filled the kitchen with warmth.
